New Records: Tyler O'Neill hit two home runs with three RBI, marking his 27th home run of the season and his 11th career multihomer game, with six this year.
The White Sox are on pace to finish 36-126, tying the 1962 New York Mets for the most losses since 1900.
Key Match Events: Tyler O'Neill cleared the Green Monster with a home run off Enyel De Los Santos in the fifth inning.
Boston won its second straight game after a five-game losing streak and trails the Minnesota Twins for the AL's final wild card berth.
Post-Match Reflections: Boston won the season series against the White Sox for the first time since 2019.
Trevor Story returned from injury and contributed with an RBI single in his first game since April 5.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Boston improved to 35-13 when wearing its yellow alternate jerseys, including a 20-9 record since the start of 2023.
Cooper Criswell made his first start since being removed after four perfect innings.
Others: White Sox third baseman Miguel Vargas was 0 for 4 with two strikeouts after missing two games with a right eye abrasion.
Red Sox pitcher Isaiah Campbell was recalled and placed on the 60-day injured list.
